name: places/ChIJIyW3j4ZZwokRNXWEmM59-ws
formattedAddress: 45 Rivington St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 45 Rivington St, New York, NY 10002, USA

originalText.text: Horrible experience at this place.  Don’t get deceived by the serene waves or sunflowers on the screens in the waiting room.  First, It’s impossible to make an appointment. Staff at main desk is incompetent, poorly trained and they have no empathy.  There might be 3-4 staff members  at a time and none of them may be taking in people.  They won’t even look or acknowledge you. They just type or whatever else they do.  Too bad that the one check in kiosk doesn’t work.  It’ll be great to just not having to deal with any of them. I mean really. Better deal with a machine.  Spouse had to go through several intakes ($$$) for substance abuse after they changed locations.  Program is more focused on enrollment ($$$$) than actually helping people. There is no really individualized therapy even during individual therapies. Yep. Do yourself a favor and for substance abuse reach out to a non profit like CMA and AAA in the city. You’ll be better off.  I’ve seen more changes in my spouse after attending 2 sessions at the non profit and at no cost than 12 sessions at Mount Sinai and the insurance headaches. We finally left Mount Sinai but they keep scheduling appointments without our consent.  Run away!

originalText.text: The first time I went for the intake everything was ok, but when I got sick a week later and I tried to make a new appointment is so frustrating,  nobody answered the phone. I called to all their numbers all day, and I left some voice mails, nobody called me back., and  noone answered the phone.  I think they should hired more responsible people, at least 3 three o 4 four to answered the phone, specifically when patients suffer from anxiety and depression .

originalText.text: Do not bring your child here for help. They will call Child services on you. Their concern is reporting the parents instead of finding the solution of helping.  After they call child services on you they sincerely feel they have done the right thing . My child isn't in school because of her mental health,  not because I  the parent wants to keep her home. She's 15 teen, the system is broken.  Please find a place that sincerely cares . Three woman made a ridiculous decision on calling child services on a parent who was trying to seek help for her teen.

originalText.text:
This building is basically brand spanking new. There's free wi-fi, and automatic filtered water if you bring a bottle.
The main entrance will lead you to the security desk with the metal detectors on the right side. They will take your name and or ID to check if you have an appointment on the list. Then they will ask if you are carrying any sharp objects in general.

For Psychiatric appointments, it'll be on the 2nd floor.
The front desk there will actually check you in to your appointments. It's usually best to be there 15 minutes prior to the appointment time, in case it's busy and there's a line.

My experience so far has been positive after coming here for a few months. My doctor is very professional and friendly. I'm not worried about what medication I'm being put on because there's full transparency and she actually explains everything, and we discuss it. She's been undoing the damage that my last doctor has done to me.
And with the hospital's app, I can read the notes written by my doctor after each appointment. (Which I love)

Cons:

* Not all aspects of your appointments here are linked with the Mount Sinai app. (EX: messaging your doctor, scheduling appointments, requesting refills, or calling the actual building or doctor because the # given in the app isn't for this building)
There's a phone # for your doctor. A phone # for the 2nd floor front desk for this building. So don't get it mixed up with what phone # is displayed in the app. It'll leave you playing phone tag in pure frustration when you really need to call on the spot. (I learned the hard way already ....)

* They don't offer telehealth appointments here. (I really wish they would)

originalText.text: I really appreciate to share with you about this new opportunity for people who are Addicted and other things. But I really know that it is going to be a fabulous place for Mental health care and I didn't have the opportunity to go there yet because opening is new Wednesday. And you will hear from me what a beautiful place it is gonna be for lots of Help for the people who need it.Thank you .Good luck and God bless with your new life here for help .
